---
id: create-player
title: CreatePlayer
description: >-
  Call this API to create a cloud player. After successful creation, the cloud
  player will automatically load the passed media resources and publish the
  stream to the specified room for playback.
api: >-
  
info_path: extended_services/cloud_player/en/server/open-api-desc
date: '2026-02-04'
---

<h1 className={"openapi__heading"}>CreatePlayer</h1>

<MethodEndpoint method={"post"} path={"/"}></MethodEndpoint>


Call this API to create a cloud player. After successful creation, the cloud player will automatically load the passed media resources and publish the stream to the specified room for playback.

<Warning title="Warning">

Under the same AppID, a maximum of 50 running (not destroyed) cloud players are allowed to exist simultaneously. If you need to increase the limit, please contact ZEGOCLOUD Technical Support for assistance.
</Warning>

<Note title="Note">Call frequency limit: 20 times/second</Note>

## Request

Application Id, a unique user credential assigned by ZEGOCLOUD. Can be obtained from <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://console.zegocloud.com/\">ZEGOCLOUD Console</a>.","required":true,"schema":{"type":"number","format":"uint32"}}}></ParamsItem><ParamsItem className={"paramsItem"} param={{"name":"SignatureNonce","in":"query","description":"ðŸ’¡Common parameter. 16-digit hexadecimal random string (hex encoding of 8-byte random number). For the generation algorithm, please refer to <a href=\"/cloud-player-server/accessing-server-apis#signature-example\">Signature Example</a>.","required":true,"schema":{"type":"string"}}}></ParamsItem><ParamsItem className={"paramsItem"} param={{"name":"Timestamp","in":"query","description":"ðŸ’¡Common parameter. Signature version number.","required":true,"schema":{"type":"string","default":"2.0","enum":["2.0"]}}}></ParamsItem><ParamsItem className={"paramsItem"} param={{"name":"Signature","in":"query","description":"ðŸ’¡Common parameter. <MimeTabs className={"openapi-tabs__mime request"}><TabItem label={"application/json"} value={"application/json-schema"}><details style={{}} className={"openapi-markdown__details mime"} data-collapsed={false} open={true}><summary style={{}} className={"openapi-markdown__details-summary-mime"}><h3 className={"openapi-markdown__details-summary-header-body"}>Body</h3><strong className={"openapi-schema__required"}>required</strong></summary><ul className={"request-schema-first-body-node-container"}><SchemaItem collapsible={false} name={"StreamUrl"} required={true} schemaName={"string"} qualifierMessage={"**Possible values:** `<= 1024 characters`"} schema={{"type":"string","description":"The address of the media resource, which must be a valid HTTP/HTTPS address with a length within 1024 bytes. Only one parameter can be selected here, where StreamUrl indicates creating a single player, and StreamUrlList indicates creating a list player.","maxLength":1024,"example":"https://xxx.com/video/test.mp4"}}></SchemaItem><SchemaItem collapsible={false} name={"StreamUrlList"} required={false} schemaName={"string[]"} qualifierMessage={undefined} schema={{"type":"array","description":"The address list of media resources, used for continuously playing multiple media resources. Supports up to 100 file addresses with a total byte length not exceeding 50000.\n> **Note**\n>\n> This feature is disabled by default. If you need to enable and use it, please contact ZEGOCLOUD Technical Support for configuration.\n\nOnly one parameter can be selected here, where StreamUrl indicates creating a single player, and StreamUrlList indicates creating a list player.\n","items":{"type":"string"}}}></SchemaItem><SchemaItem collapsible={false} name={"BackupStreamUrl"} required={false} schemaName={"string"} qualifierMessage={"**Possible values:** `<= 1024 characters`"} schema={{"type":"string","description":"The backup address of the media resource, which must be a valid HTTP/HTTPS address with a length within 1024 bytes. When the address in the StreamUrl parameter fails to access, the cloud player will try to access the backup address.","maxLength":1024}}></SchemaItem><SchemaItem collapsible={false} name={"RoomId"} required={true} schemaName={"string"} qualifierMessage={"**Possible values:** `<= 128 characters`"} schema={{"type":"string","description":"Publish stream to the specified room ID, with a length within 128 bytes. <b>When calling this API, if the RoomId does not exist, a room will be automatically created.</b>","maxLength":128,"example":"room_12"}}></SchemaItem><SchemaItem collapsible={false} name={"StreamId"} required={false} schemaName={"string"} qualifierMessage={"**Possible values:** `<= 256 characters`"} schema={{"type":"string","description":"The stream ID of the cloud player publishing to the specified room, with a length within 256 bytes, only supporting numbers, English characters, and '-', '_'. <b>Please note that under the same AppID, StreamId must be unique. When this parameter is not filled in, ZEGOCLOUD server will randomly assign an ID.</b>","maxLength":256,"example":"stream"}}></SchemaItem><SchemaItem collapsible={false} name={"PlayerName"} required={false} schemaName={"string"} qualifierMessage={"**Possible values:** `<= 64 characters`"} schema={{"type":"string","description":"The name of the cloud player, with a length within 64 bytes, default is empty.\n- <b>Under the same AppId, multiple cloud players with empty PlayerName can exist, but multiple running cloud players with duplicate PlayerName are not allowed.</b>\n- <b>The destroyed player name PlayerName can be created and used again, but it is recommended that developers avoid creating players with the same PlayerName.</b>\n","maxLength":64,"example":"player_1"}}></SchemaItem><SchemaItem collapsible={true} className={"schemaItem"}><details style={{}} className={"openapi-markdown__details"}><summary style={{}}><span className={"openapi-schema__container"}><strong className={"openapi-schema__property"}>VideoOptions</strong><span className={"openapi-schema__name"}> object</span></span></summary><div className={"schema-description-container"}><div className={"schema-description"}>Video transcoding parameter configuration. <b>Please note that when this parameter is not filled in, all fields contained in it use default values.</b></div><SchemaItem collapsible={false} name={"Width"} required={false} schemaName={"number"} qualifierMessage={"**Possible values:** `>= 1` and `<= 3000`"} schema={{"type":"number","description":"Video width, value range is [1, 3000], unit is px, default value is the width of the original media resource.\n> **Note**\n>\n> <ul><li>When an odd value is passed in the range, it will be automatically rounded up to an even number.</li><li>When either Width or Height parameter is set to 1, it means audio-only stream publishing.</li></ul>\n","minimum":1,"maximum":3000,"example":360}}></SchemaItem><SchemaItem collapsible={false} name={"Height"} required={false} schemaName={"number"} qualifierMessage={"**Possible values:** `>= 1` and `<= 3000`"} schema={{"type":"number","description":"Video height, value range is [1, 3000], unit is px, default value is the height of the original media resource.\n> **Note**\n>\n> <ul><li>When an odd value is passed in the range, it will be automatically rounded up to an even number.</li><li>When either Width or Height parameter is set to 1, it means audio-only stream publishing.</li></ul>\n","minimum":1,"maximum":3000,"example":640}}></SchemaItem><SchemaItem collapsible={false} name={"ShortEdge"} required={false} schemaName={"int"} qualifierMessage={"**Possible values:** `>= 0` and `<= 2160`"} schema={{"type":"number","format":"int","description":"Video short edge length, value range is [0,2160], unit is px. Default value is 0, indicating that the short edge adaptive feature is not enabled.\n> **Note**\n>\n> <ul><li>When an odd value is passed in the range, it will be automatically rounded up to an even number.</li><li>Once the short edge adaptive feature is enabled, it can only be updated, and cannot be cancelled.</li><li>When both ShortEdge and Width/Height are set, Width/Height takes precedence.</li><li>After calculating the short edge, the resolution cannot exceed 4k(3840*2160), otherwise the original media resource width and height will be used.</li></ul>\n","minimum":0,"maximum":2160,"example":360}}></SchemaItem><SchemaItem collapsible={false} name={"VideoBitrate"} required={false} schemaName={"number"} qualifierMessage={"**Possible resolution and frame rate.For example, when the input resolution is 360*640, the VideoBitrate of the output stream is set to 600 kbps.","minimum":1,"maximum":50000,"example":600}}></SchemaItem><SchemaItem collapsible={false} name={"VideoCodec"} required={false} schemaName={"number"} qualifierMessage={"**Possible values:** [`0`, the window, there may be black borders, default value.\n- 1: Crop mode, video is scaled proportionally until it fills the entire window, some parts may be cropped.\n","enum":[0,1],"example":1}}></SchemaItem></div></details></SchemaItem><SchemaItem collapsible={true} className={"schemaItem"}><details style={{}} <b>Please note that when this parameter is not filled in, all fields contained in it use default values.</b></div><SchemaItem collapsible={false} name={"AudioCodec"} required={false} default value.\n- 1: HE-AAC, sampling rate: 44100 kHz.\n- 6: OPUS, sampling rate: 48000 kHz.\n","enum":[0,1,6],"example":1}}></SchemaItem><SchemaItem collapsible={false} name={"AudioBitrate"} required={false} schemaName={"number"} qualifierMessage={"**Possible values:** `>= 1` and `<= 192`"} schema={{"type":"number","description":"Audio bitrate, value range is [1, 192], unit is kbps, default value is 48 kbps.","minimum":1,"maximum":192,"example":48}}></SchemaItem><SchemaItem collapsible={false} name={"SoundChannel"} required={false} schemaName={"number"} qualifierMessage={"**Possible values:** [`1`, `2`]"} schema={{"type":"number","description":"Number of audio channels.\n- 1: Mono, default value.\n- 2: Stereo.\n","enum":[1,2],"example":1}}></SchemaItem><SchemaItem collapsible={false} name={"Volume"} required={false} schemaName={"number"} qualifierMessage={"**Possible values:** `>= 0` and `<= 200`"} schema={{"type":"number","description":"Volume value, range is [0, 200], default value is 100, indicating the original volume of the audio.","minimum":0,"maximum":200,"example":100}}></SchemaItem></div></details></SchemaItem><SchemaItem collapsible={false} name={"PlayTime"} required={false} schemaName={"number"} qualifierMessage={undefined} schema={{"type":"number","description":"Unix timestamp (seconds) when starting to play the online media stream, <b>value range is [CreateTime - 86400, CreateTime + 1800] (CreateTime is the creation time of the cloud player, which will be returned after successfully calling this API. If you need to increase the limit, please contact ZEGOCLOUD Technical Support)</b>, default value is 0, indicating that when the cloud player is successfully created, it will automatically start playing the online media stream.\n- When PlayTime = CreateTime, the cloud player will automatically start playing when successfully created.\n- When PlayTime > CreateTime, the cloud player will preload the media resources after successful creation, and start playing at the set PlayTime moment, achieving the effect of scheduled playback.\n- When PlayTime < CreateTime, the cloud player will start playing from the position corresponding to the `CreateTime - PlayTime` moment after successful creation. For example, when cloud player A encounters an exception during operation, you can create a new cloud player B, set B's PlayTime to the Unix timestamp when A started playing, and when B is successfully created, it can directly start playing from A's current progress.\n\nFor example, if CreateTime is 20:00 in the evening, when PlayTime is 20:00, the cloud player will start playing directly after successful creation; when PlayTime is 20:10 (CreateTime + 600), the cloud player will start loading resources after successful creation and start playing at 20:10; when PlayTime is 19:55 (CreateTime - 300), the cloud player will start playing directly from the 6th minute of the media stream after successful creation.\n","example":0}}></SchemaItem><SchemaItem collapsible={false} name={"RepeatTimes"} required={false} schemaName={"number"} qualifierMessage={undefined} schema={{"type":"number","description":"Number of playbacks.\n- 1: Play the media stream 1 time, default value.\n- -1: Automatic loop playback.\n- n: Custom number of times to play the media stream, must be greater than 0.\n","example":1}}></SchemaItem><SchemaItem collapsible={false} name={"SeekTo"} required={false} schemaName={"number"} qualifierMessage={undefined} schema={{"type":"number","description":"Specify playback progress (seconds), default value is 0, indicating starting playback from the beginning position.","example":0}}></SchemaItem><SchemaItem collapsible={false} name={"MaxIdleTime"} required={false} schemaName={"number"} qualifierMessage={"**Possible values:** `>= 5` and `<= 3000`"} schema={{"type":"number","description":"The maximum duration that the cloud player is in <b>idle state (referring to Status being 2, 5, 6, please refer to the return parameters of [Query Cloud Player Task List](/cloud-player-server/describe-players) for details)</b>, that is, the maximum duration that the media stream is in a non-playing state. Value range is [5, 3000], unit is seconds, default value is 300 seconds, when greater than 3000, it will be automatically adjusted to 3000.\n- After the idle state exceeds the set MaxIdleTime, the player will be automatically destroyed.\n- If MaxIdleTime is less than 5, ZEGOCLOUD server will automatically adjust it to 5; if it is greater than 600, ZEGOCLOUD server will automatically adjust it to 3000.\n","minimum":5,"maximum":3000,"example":30}}></SchemaItem><SchemaItem collapsible={true} className={"schemaItem"}><details style={{}} className={"openapi-markdown__details"}><summary style={{}}><span className={"openapi-schema__container"}><strong className={"openapi-schema__property"}>StreamData</strong><span className={"openapi-schema__name"}> object</span></span></summary><div className={"schema-description-container"}><div className={"schema-description"}>Data configuration carried by the real-time media stream (such as playback progress information, etc.). This data will be transmitted to the stream player as SEI information along with the video frames. The stream player can obtain this data by listening to callbacks such as [onPlayerSyncRecvSEI](https://www.zegocloud.com/article/api?doc=Express_Video_SDK_API~java_android~class~IZegoEventHandler#on-player-sync-recv-sei) on the client. The SEI information transmitted by this parameter is in JSON data format by default, and developers can parse it in JSON format. For example, the SEI content is `null`, where CloudPlayerPlayingProgress represents the current playback progress of the video frame, and 1000 indicates that the current playback progress is 1000ms.</div><SchemaItem collapsible={false} name={"Enable"} required={false} schemaName={"number"} qualifierMessage={"**Possible values:** [`0`, `1`]"} schema={{"type":"number","description":"Whether to enable StreamData configuration.\n- 0: Not enabled, default value.\n- 1: Enabled.\n","enum":[0,1],"example":1}}></SchemaItem><SchemaItem collapsible={false} name={"Interval"} required={false} schemaName={"number"} qualifierMessage={undefined} schema={{"type":"number","description":"Set the sending frequency (milliseconds) of SEI information used to transmit StreamData data, default value is 1000, indicating that 1 SEI information carrying StreamData data is sent every 1 second.","example":1000}}></SchemaItem></div></details></SchemaItem><SchemaItem collapsible={true} className={"schemaItem"}><details style={{}} className={"openapi-markdown__details"}><summary style={{}}><span className={"openapi-schema__container"}><strong className={"openapi-schema__property"}>ExtensionParams</strong><span className={"openapi-schema__name"}> object[]</span></span></summary><div className={"schema-description-container"}><div className={"schema-description"}>Extension parameters, set in `Key-Value` format. This parameter is generally used for unconventional special parameters or some technical previews. Please fill in according to the actual situation. Regular cloud player tasks can ignore it.</div><li className={"opening-array-bracket-container"}><div className={"opening-array-bracket"}><span className={"opening-array-bracket_text"}>Array</span><span className={"opening-array-bracket_symbol"}>[</span></div></li><SchemaItem collapsible={false} name={"Key"} required={false} schemaName={"string"} qualifierMessage={undefined} schema={{"type":"string","description":"Key value."}}></SchemaItem><SchemaItem collapsible={false} name={"Value"} required={false} schemaName={"string"} qualifierMessage={undefined} schema={{"type":"string","description":"Value."}}></SchemaItem><li className={"closing-array-bracket-container"}><div className={"closing-array-bracket"}>]</div></li></div></details></SchemaItem><SchemaItem collapsible={false} name={"RoomUserUpdate"} required={false} schemaName={"number"} qualifierMessage={"**Possible values:** [`0`, `1`]"} schema={{"type":"number","description":"When you automatically create a room because the RoomId does not exist when creating a cloud player, whether users entering or leaving the room will trigger the onRoomUserUpdate callback notification on the client of other users in the room.\n- 0: No (default).\n- 1: Yes.\n> **Note**\n>\n> If RoomId exists, this parameter is invalid.\n","enum":[0,1],"example":0}}></SchemaItem><SchemaItem collapsible={false} name={"DelayDestroySeconds"} required={false} schemaName={"number"} qualifierMessage={"**Possible values:** `>= 0` and `<= 3600`"} schema={{"type":"number","description":"Delay time for destroying the cloud player, unit is seconds. Range is [0,3600], default value is 0.\n\n> **Note**\n>\n> If you need to adjust the value range of the delay destroy time, please contact ZEGOCLOUD Technical Support.\n","minimum":0,"maximum":3600,"example":0}}></SchemaItem></ul></details></TabItem></MimeTabs>

signature.</td></tr>\n<tr><td>100000005</td><td>Signature error.</td><td>Please confirm whether the parameters for generating the signature are correct.</td></tr>\n<tr><td>350006001</td><td>API failed.</td><td>Please contact ZEGOCLOUD Technical Support for assistance.</td></tr>\n<tr><td>350006003</td><td>Invalid input parameter.</td><td>Please adjust the value of the corresponding parameter according to the Message prompt.</td></tr>\n<tr><td>350006006</td><td>Service not activated.</td><td>Please contact ZEGOCLOUD Technical Support to activate the service permission.</td></tr>\n<tr><td>350006007</td><td>Cloud player concurrency limit reached.</td><td>Please confirm whether the number of currently created cloud players exceeds the limit, the default limit is 50.</td></tr>\n<tr><td>350006008</td><td>A running cloud player with the same name currently exists.</td><td>Please confirm whether a cloud player with the same PlayerName and running exists.</td></tr>\n<tr><td>350010000</td><td>System error.</td><td>Please contact ZEGOCLOUD Technical Support for assistance.</td></tr>\n</tbody>\n</table>\n","example":0}}></SchemaItem><SchemaItem
